intro: Grindelia nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its resinous, glandular leaves and yellow flowers. The plant thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Its unique chemical composition includes sesquiterpene lactones, which contribute to its medicinal and ecological significance. Grindelia nelsonii plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native range.
